intro: Poa dschungarica, commonly known as the Dzungarian grass, is a perennial grass species native to Central Asia. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as steppes and rocky slopes. The plant has slender, upright stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, adapted to withstand arid conditions. Poa dschungarica plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems in its native range.
